event.title: built a home on one side of what is now

data.event: Martenet's map of 1878 shows McCausland built a home on one side of what is now Route 440 and a tavern or inn on the other side.
Ararat Lodge of Masons, Maryland, which moved its meeting place in 1809 from a tavern in Delta, Pennsylvania to George McCausland's tavern in Dublin.
The lodge remained there until 1826, then moved to the old Masonic Lodge on Bond Street in Bel Air.
Along with several of the older homes, it burned in 1971.
